channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CME halts futures trading on stocks, currencies and other markets, citing data center cooling issue
item.description: Black Friday trading was off to an auspicious start after exchange operator CME was forced to halt futures trading on Friday.

item.title: ‘Today’ host Dylan Dreyer sells New York apartment for $1.8 million following split-up with Brian Fichera
item.description: “Today” host Dylan Dreyer and her estranged husband, Brian Fichera, have sold their longtime marital home in New York City.

item.title: ‘We’re struggling’: I’m 41 with 5 kids and $46K in credit-card debt. Do I raid my $1.2 million IRAs to pay it off?
item.description: “I bring in $7,200 a month from my pension and disability benefits.”

item.title: Bitcoin has moved back above $90,000. Why this strategist says a return to $100,000 is not far away
item.description: BTIG’s chief technical strategist Jonathan Krinksy said bitcoin has just exited seasonal period of bottoming.

item.title: Is the stock market open on Black Friday?
item.description: Thanksgiving week comes with plenty of holiday-adjusted business hours, including, of course on Wall Street — so here’s what you need to know.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
